solution_line_template: The total marks Amaya scored more in Music than in Maths is {maths_less_fraction} * {music_score} = <<{maths_less_fraction}*{music_score}={marks_less_in_maths}>>{marks_less_in_maths} marks.
So the total marks she scored in Maths is {music_score} - {marks_less_in_maths} = <<{music_score}-{marks_less_in_maths}={maths_score}>>{maths_score} marks.

If she scored {maths_fewer_than_arts} marks fewer in Maths than in Arts, then he scored {maths_score} + {maths_fewer_than_arts} = <<{maths_score}+{maths_fewer_than_arts}={arts_score}>>{arts_score} in Arts.

If she scored {social_studies_more_than_music} marks more in Social Studies than in Music, then she scored {music_score} + {social_studies_more_than_music} = <<{social_studies_more_than_music}+{music_score}={social_studies_score}>>{social_studies_score} marks in Social Studies.

The total number of marks for all the subjects is {music_score} + {maths_score} + {arts_score} + {social_studies_score} = <<{music_score}+{maths_score}+{arts_score}+{social_studies_score}={total_marks}>>{total_marks} marks.
